intro: Tridactyle thomensis, commonly known as the Toménsis tridactyl, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
